intro: Psychotria meridensis, commonly known as the Andean psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Psychotria meridensis is notable for its chemical composition, containing various alkaloids that have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties.
